text: Hello.  I've suggested a pull request to Base.Docs to improve `HTML` so that it can nest property.  I don't see any detrimental side-effect of this change (the existing behavior is pretty much unusable so I can't imagine anyone relying upon it).  <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/38889>

elements.text: Hello.  I've suggested a pull request to Base.Docs to improve
HTML
so that it can nest property.  I don't see any detrimental side-effect of this change (the existing behavior is pretty much unusable so I can't imagine anyone relying upon it).

text:
I don't understand what's going on in my Documenter build, almost every example block errors with `MethodError: no method matching iterate(::Nothing)`<https://gitlab.com/JuliaGPU/AbstractPlotting-jl/-/jobs/912130931>

The return objects in these blocks are all new kinds of figure objects that I'm introducing in that PR, and granted a lot of them should error, but at least a couple shouldn't. I have only overloaded the `display` method for them, but I don't even understand where iteration is going on? I tested a very simple block and that worked fine for me locally..

Is Documenter doing something with my return values that they don't allow?
